website_summaries.verdict: The Grind Wireless offers a comfortable fit and good sound for its relatively modest price point..
pros: The Skullcandy Grind sounds surprisingly good for its modest price, is lightweight and comfortable to wear and has a remote/microphone built into the left earcup
Headband is made of metal instead of plastic
cons: Doesn't fold up or come with a carrying case
only performs OK as a headset for making calls

customer_reviews.title: Great hands-free device for calls and gaming, music sound quality and comfort are just OK
customer_reviews.text: Quality and comfort are just OK. Bluetooth range and battery life is very good. Stylish. Great headset for phone calls, short periods of listening to music at lower bitrate. As other reviewers mention, these get uncomfortable after a few hours, especially while wearing glasses. Quality for hands-free calling is great; I've never gotten any of the "are you on speaker" complaints when using this as a hands-free device. The mic is good quality and you can wander a good distance from your phone and stay connected. **Update** After 3mo use. Bluetooth connectivity is not responsive. Takes multiple tries to connect to iPhone and PC while other Bluetooth devices connect without issues.
customer_reviews.author: amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Looks and sounds great, but too flimsy for regular use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a Xmas present for my teenage son who likes to listen to loud rock -- his earbuds were always leaking. Within a few days the "+" button was broken and we had to get an exchange. (This went smoothly, thank you Amazon.) He enjoyed it very much, was the "cool kid" on the train, we never had to hear his music, and the unit looks and sounds great. Bluetooth connection is very easy. But... It's now three months later and the micro-usb connector through which it charges is broken, so it's basically useless. Maybe he's been a little rough with it but still this points to inadequate manufacturing quality or flimsy design.
customer_reviews.author: Guido van Rossum

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought this off a recommendation from WireCutter.com I am not an audiophile so I am not going to go into sound quality; with that side, I am happy with the sound quality. The battery life is decent; it can easily last through my 8 hr work day in which i use this on and off. It is quite comfortable to wear even for more big head. The built quality is decent; the material does not feel cheap. Only downside is that it is not foldable, so it is not as easily to carry around in the bag. Overall, I really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yikchi Fung

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: I really like the color although that is neither here nor there because I can’t see them whilst on me head. I also enjoy the very high quality sound. I have listened through Bose and Beats. These have a very close sound quality although lack noise canceling. They are not listed as noise canceling and the are a fraction of the cost. The battery lasts a bit longer than advertised which is a strange wonder. They fit very comfortably and stay on your head with moderate movement. Tips on what to do with these awesome headphones. Scuba=no Painting =yes Fighting =no Kissing=yes Sword fighting =no Democratic debate =yes Hair coloring= no Singing =yes Just buy them already..
customer_reviews.author: Miceland

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting and Better Quality Than Their Other Products
customer_reviews.text: I have had these since 2017 and they are tough and durable. I use them working out, running and they have held up to drops and light water exposure(one of the plastic casings came off about a month ago after a drop but super glue fixed it). Battery charge is still great, after about a year and 1/2 the foam covers gave out but it was a cheap replacement. Don't usually write reviews, but these have been great...I even bought other Skullcandy headphones but they were cheap and made of all weak plastic and felt like they could break at any time, not these. Sound quality is good... doesn't cancel noise, but they are $50.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Grind headset at the gym for a few weeks and so far so good. The battery seems to last a long time and charges quickly. It pairs easily with my android phone and fits my head tightly enough to prevent falling off or moving when exercising. If you are into heavy bass this headset may be for you. I found it overwhelming and had to make adjustments to the graphic equalizer in my app to cut the bass down. I haven't used it for phone calls so can't comment on that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, baseless, tinny sound, and no bargain at that. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try these out in a convertible. These cups are fairly small but covered most of the ears. The sound was thin and tinny, much inferior to the base, depth and definition of even standard iPhone 6S in ear headphones. A little static noted also. I decided to return them after about 60 seconds each of several genres. Construction seems appropriate to orice except the “pleather” cover for the ear pads are also very thin and even grainy, wrinkling when compressed. I think the covers would last at least a week or two.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice for me.
customer_reviews.text: These are not meant to be noise cancellation headphones so I’m not sure why they asked. They do what they’re supposed to do. I had a pair previously that I used until they completely wore out which took a much longer time than any other headphones I’ve had in this century. I don’t really use the rechargeable battery feature because I feel no need to be wireless and I don’t want to be without them while they charge. I despise earbuds. I’m very happy with these headphones and hope they are still making them when I wear these out,
customer_reviews.author: Catharine Mefford

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable with thick glasses
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good set of headphones. I will say though that I have plastic rim glasses and if I wear these ALL DAY at work (which I do often) they do start to make my temples sore where my glasses arm is. That’s wearing these for like 8 hours straight though, and my plastic rimmed glasses are about 1/8” thick at the ear piece- just something to be aware of. All that said the battery life is great and the sound quality is quite good too. They’re even comfortable if I wear my contacts.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bot

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth broke after two months
customer_reviews.text: Before breaking, these were nice portable headphones. Light; comfortable; convenient. Sound quality is commensurate with the price... ie fine for my purpose of watching lectures for online courses, but not comparable to its more-expensive cousins by the usual brands. The Bluetooth functionality broke after two months; occurred mid-use. Support suggested two things which did not work, marked as solved, then closed the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: 3rd set I've bought, they work really well.
customer_reviews.text: I have one set of these for me to use on the computer and a second set for my wife to use when she's watching TV. On the TV, I use one of those cheap TosLink to bluetooth transmitters and it works great with it. Nearly zero lag. On my PC, I don't notice any lag at all. I got a 3rd set because the cable my wife used to charge hers shorted out and melted the headphone ear can/housing. The headphones still worked, but the charge port was toast. She's now using the cord that came with the headphones. Should have used that in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan L

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable on the ears after about 30 min of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hoping for an upgrade from my Hesh 2 wireless for podcasts while I do mundane chores, but these are by far much worse in comparison. Sound quality if about the same(so, not bad). But these headphones are extremely uncomfortable as they press into your ears in order to stay in place. When bending over or having sudden movements they fall right off no matter how I try to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Nadeem

customer_reviews.title: Rock it
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I have used them less often than i wanted but love the sound for such a compact set of head phones. I have to remove after a couple of hours as they do tend to bother my ears after that amount of time. I couldn't use them on a cross country flight without a break. Perfect for walking around the house and listening to music in comfort. They stay in place well.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: They even look good!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to invest money into another pair of Beats. Which I have been using for the past five years and I LOVE! I was gearing towards a brief use of these while on a trip. Well, they are super comfortable, hold a nice long charge and best of all, have really good sound quality. Now, I listen to my music with a ton of bottom, never to much base for me, and these make the everything sound good. Two friends have bought them now, just from testing my pair. I haven't bought my Beats yet. Hmmmmm....
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: work fine, not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These connect to my PC, work fine, sound fine. The problem is comfort. I find the pads rather thin, or at least they don't cushion my ears enough. After about 45 mins or so they feel hard and uncomfortable, not to mention very warm. Because of this they don't get used that often. I wear glasses, though I'm not sure that makes all that much of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: E-consumer

customer_reviews.title: I love them! Sound great
customer_reviews.text: I love them! Sound great! I've never tried Beats or Bose, but I cannot imagine they could be significantly better than these, especially for the price range. They work great with my laptop right out of the box. I just ordered this dongle so that they will work with the PS4: Avantree LONG RANGE Bluetooth USB Adapter for Headphones, Speakers, Driver-Free Wireless Audio Dongle Transmitter, Plug-n-Play, aptX Low Latency, for PC Mac PS4 Nintendo Switch Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Shayman King

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable on the ears. Couldn't wear for more than 20 minutes at a time. No control over size adjustment in a lateral direction. The sound quality was so-so. A cheap pair of Sony phones was just as good and didn't hurt the ears. Bluetooth seemed to work okay. Returned the phones. Amazon Prime members will be charged $6 and change to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So heavy! And color doesn't match picture.
customer_reviews.text: These are very heavy. It honestly never occurred to me to check the weight in the description, and after trying them for five minutes I realized how bad they'll be at the gym (I need headphones specifically for treadmill time). Also, the picture is a cobalt blue and these came as navy. Not attractive to me. Otherwise, the ear cushions are super soft and easy on my ears. The sound is okay but not as awesome as my old $15 set.
customer_reviews.author: Tree hugging hippie

customer_reviews.title: GOOD HEADPHONES, BUT THE PADS ARE A LITTLE HARD
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for my former wireless pair for the gym: Likes: Good sound and excellent bass, over ear (I can't stand the earbud style), blutooth connection is very good, ear pads are easy to wipe clean Dislikes: Earpads are a bit hard and WILL make sure ears sore after long wear There are always pros and cons with earbuds/earphones for the gym- I have yet to find a perfect pair.
customer_reviews.author: Tactical geek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphone with some Pros and Cons.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Really great sound. 2. Charge so fast and have amazing battery life. 3. They look awesome. 4. Build quality is great. Cons: 1. Don't fold up or swivel which makes it hard to pack in bag. 2. Ears get really sweaty if you are moving around with them IE cleaning the house while listening to music. 3. Cant wear for more than 2 hours without them feeling annoying kinda like they are squeezing your head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do I have to take these off?
customer_reviews.text: I love my new headphones. First of all, they look very expensive and sleek with a nice leather headband and matte black earpieces. The ear cushions are SO soft, a pleasure to wear. But it's not just the look and feel, these are also great-sounding headphones with impressive bass. The controls are on the back of the right earpiece which makes it easy to reach. I also appreciate that I can use these wired as well as with Bluetooth so if I'm on a plane and run out of juice I can finish my movie or keep listening to tunes.
customer_reviews.author: WorldTripper

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound and quality of these headphones and the fit is incredibly comfortable. The only problem I’ve had is that they are really hard to pair with the Bluetooth on my laptop, most of the time it doesn’t work and I have to use them with the wire. I returned the first pair thinking they were defective but the second pair had the same problem. I have another pair which is paired with my iPad and they work perfectly so the problem may be in my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones. I work in an office and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. I work in an office and I wear them all the time. They eventually become uncomfortable because they press on the cartilage in my ears, but any headphones do. They feel and look nice, the battery lasts all day and they don't scratch easily. I've even taken a few calls with them, works just fine. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bigler

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, while it lasts...
customer_reviews.text: Good while they lasted. In under 6 months they refuse to hold a charge, making them pretty much useless. I'd bought them for my wife to use while she works which precludes using a wired headset. Considering their cost, I would not purchase a Skullcandy product again... I have a set of Anker bluetooth headphones I use while mowing and they've lasted me twice as long in harsher conditions... for a LOT less money.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I've been though a ton of bluetooth earphones. I'm tough on them because I wear them to the gym and just about everywhere I go. I had a pair of Hesh2 headphones, which I lost. They are too big in my opinion, just reminded me of the 80's. Grind headphones are lighter and smaller. The sound is great and the battery life is awesome compared to other headphones. The only problem you might encounter is that they can be tight on the ears. I bent my pair open and now it's perfect. I would buy another pair when/if I lose these.
customer_reviews.author: George Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Great for working artists. Nice design, good sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great style design. They don't fold. Sound great - about 87% noise cancelling. Bluetooth helps traveling through crowded city with no cables attached. Connects easy to iPad and iPhone. If you are a working artist, or hand laborer, these are great since they are wireless. The only real con: you can't change the songs you are listening to just by pushing the side botton. Only volume and pause/play.
customer_reviews.author: Ilaria

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, comfortable headphones
customer_reviews.text: I first started with the Uproar wireless headphones, but felt they were too cheap and seemed uncomfortable on my head. I ordered these and found that they were very light and much softer on my ears, even when i was wearing glasses. I wear them for hours at a time at work and they don't hurt and the batteries last forever (not really, but 12 hours is a long time).
customer_reviews.author: Geesh

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars, but missing a couple things
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! They are quality and look sick AF. The only issues I have with them is that they apply a little too much pressure on my ears (I may just have overly sensitive ears, but I wear a headset for work everyday). I can wear them for about an hour before my right ear feels discomfort. Also you can't mute yourself from the headphones themselves while having a conversation (on the phone or gaming). This may not be true, but I haven't checked the instructions; so please reply to this review if I have misspoken. But I got these for 50$ and I am ecstatic with the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Am quite happy and satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Bulletproof setup and functions, large easy to find buttons, additional audio cable included (nice touch), soft ear pads, charges quickly. Recommended by nytimes' Wirecutter and I see why. We use it with Fire tv, but have never used the Mic, so can't comment on that. *I reserve 5 stars for "exceedingly exceptional" products.
customer_reviews.author: GeoMac

customer_reviews.title: Had them for a couple months and so far I love them. Look good
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I gave them 4 stars is because they don't fold up. Had them for a couple months and so far I love them. Look good, comfortable, sound great. Connecting to my phone was easy as well. It seems like some users have had problems with the headphones disconnecting from their device but so far I haven't experienced this. If you wear for long periods of time they do hurt your ears a bit but I think that's the case with most on ear headphones. Was going to spend more on a few different pairs I looked at but am glad I didn't, this is a great set for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For a $50 range wireless bluetooth headphone, this grind ...
customer_reviews.text: For a $50 range wireless bluetooth headphone, this grind skullcandy is quite impressive. My only complaint is the lack of battery display on my iphone. My bose headphone will always show the remaining battery on my phone so I know when to charge. For this grind, I have to wait until last 20-minute battery to hear the audio warning.
customer_reviews.author: D. Li

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Sound
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Excellent sound. Got over 100 feet of range through two walls and a heavy door. Only negative is they do not fold up like other headphones do. Not a big deal for me but others may find that a show stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bluetooth Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Wireless Headphones. My wife works out everyday and she really loves using them at the gym. She does not have any complaints at all about these headphones, thank goodness for me as I would hear about it. So these are a really great in audio sound & quality for the money. Can't go wrong with SkullCandy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy good headphones
customer_reviews.text: Love Skullcandy headphones. They are well made and sound great for the price. I've had these a while and am very happy with purchase. Build quality is very sturdy and sound quality is good. For the modest price, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dmanning

customer_reviews.title: Another safe buy when affordable does not rhyme with mediocre quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, excellent sound, good sound cancellation (without being stellarly sound-proof though which might be an advantage for staying aware of one's environment; I, personally, appreciate that) at a rather affordable price. Thumbs up Skullcandy Grinds!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Chalifour

customer_reviews.title: On the ear headphones not over the ear
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than anticipated. Uncomfortable on my ears because they sit directly on my ears instead of over them and I've been accused of having small ears. Recommended for children, female twileks, and adults with very tiny ears. I can't speak to the sound quality because I immediately hated them upon trying them on. I thought maybe it was just me but my wife found them uncomfortable too. I don't want to leave without saying something nice... They look good I guess.
customer_reviews.author: ambrose x jensen

customer_reviews.title: These sound great! They don't fall off when working out
customer_reviews.text: These sound great! They don't fall off when working out, and very light weight. I like my music loud and listening to these makes me feel like I'm in concert. Anyway, for the money, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: JCrew

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I tried and returned multiple pairs of on-ear and over-eat headphones for poor sound quality, poor noise cancellation, inability to use while running. These have been such a pleasant surprise. Great sound quality for the price point; crisp highs and unmuddied low range. Comfortable and don’t squeeze your head at all, while also being secure enough to run or play basketball while wearing. Very impressed by skullcandy after years as a loyal Sony customer.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Frydlewicz

customer_reviews.title: Love these and very happy with the sound quality and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these and very happy with the sound quality and super quick wireless connectivity to blue tooth. They come with a charging cable but I almost never charge them and they seem to hold a charge forever. I chose the ones with the red plaid liner on the head band and couldn't love them more
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: The fit was uncomfortable on my ears. I couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: The fit was uncomfortable on my ears. I couldn't wear for more than an hour. Returned and got some over the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Tmitty

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones great price
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones but I think they have been discontinued (not positive) but I hope not. They are very comfortable to wear, even for long periods of time. The sound quality is AMAZING! High end quality at a great great price! Don’t hesitate to purchase these
customer_reviews.author: John Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Comfortable Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Have used for over 4 months and they work great for moderate workouts and for comfortable music listening. Very happy with them, the sound quality was much better than expected. On-ear is comfortable and the pads are holding up perfect - no noticeable wear. Have multiple transmitting systems, Apple, Dell, Xiaomi, Huawei, all give great BTooth sound to these headphones - but an old LG phone really puts out amazing 3D depth of music. Really impressed and very happy with these Skullcandy Grind on-ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Defective product and worst customer service
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective product that with very minimal use and writhin a few months started playing distorted sounds. When I reached their customer service as I’m still under warranty, I was asked to pay for shipping the item and overall was treated quite rudely. I guess that part of the warranty states that it’s the customers to bare the cost of sending a defective item but it feels SO wrong. I will never buy from Skullcandy again.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: I really like these!
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable after long periods of wear and the battery has not let me down yet! I've had multiple days of wear without having to do more than an hour of charge. I charge it overnight about every 3 days of use. The sound is not bass monster, but it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this headset. He is hard of hearing and always looking for a better headset to watch tv. These are the best by far!
customer_reviews.author: tremie2000

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves them and they are still going!
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are wireless bluetooth. No Mic, but these did the trick for music and on the go. Daughter loves the colors and they are put together well!
customer_reviews.author: lopro310

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound
customer_reviews.text: These have a nice sound and the battery is pretty good so far. They do get a bit tight when I am wearing my glasses and begin to hurt a bit. Without my glasses on they are quite comfortable. Otherwise I was looking for something to wear while crafting so I can listen to music or movies and not have to listen to my teenager play Xbox and these work.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Kuczera

customer_reviews.title: They work great. Sync with my phone flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Bought for working out but may just use for leisure. They work great. Sync with my phone flawlessly. Very comfortable. Battery lasts for hours. Microphone does its job. Only issue I had was they cant really be tightened. Jumping or laying down for certain exercises would be a pain since they would be falling off constantly. Also, cleaning the ear muffs isn't possible. They aren't marketed as gym headphones as far as I know so I will still give them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Cnet was Right about these being great under $100 Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Their look and sound quality are amazing. I'm thinking of buying another pair just to have them in storage in case the originals get lost. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge G

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. I think the audio is lacking a little in crisp delivery, but I love loud, clean music. Also, it works better for people with bigger heads & hair. Me... not so much.
customer_reviews.author: C L

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones (but what else would you expect from skullcandy) ...
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones (but what else would you expect from skullcandy) they blow away beats solo 2 wireless and JBL synchros I bought for my 8 year old daughter thinking they wouldn't be too loud seeing as they are half the price of the beats and blew the beats away in sound quality had to put the sound block on in her iPad and iPod
customer_reviews.author: Keith Lamonica

customer_reviews.title: Good if you are sitting still
customer_reviews.text: These sound really good and do a pretty good job of noise cancellation, however, be aware that they are very heavy on top. When you are have them on and look down they fall off every time. These would be great if you never moved your head. :)
customer_reviews.author: Owen Brindisi

customer_reviews.title: Another Good Skullcandy
customer_reviews.text: I love Skullcandy and these are no exception. I prefer the ones with pads that go over the ear (like the Crushers) but for $50 these were a no brainer. The connection is great and goes at least 30 feet. They're plenty loud and the sound quality is comparable to $200 headphones.
customer_reviews.author: FingerPickin

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad set of headphones. Battery lasts a work week's worth of 2hrs a day commuting. Switching between paired devices can sometimes be annoying, but usually by the 4th try it works. Also, if you're looking for loud headphones, these may not be for you. Riding on the subway I'be probably got these turned up to over 80% and still feel like there's a lot of outside noise that leaks through.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G. Tan

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the wife. She loved the color and the clarity of sound. She said the headphones were very comfortable and did not hurt her ears. That's high praise indeed.
customer_reviews.author: gohogsgo

customer_reviews.title: too difficult to make it work properly.
customer_reviews.text: too confusing to operate as a wireless headset. works great when plugged in to the device. sound quality is good and the headset is comfortable. i just can't get the "wireless" use to work.
customer_reviews.author: steven b mabel

customer_reviews.title: Sounds okay but weak Bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth connection is weak , my older philips Bluetooth headphones have a much wider Bluetooth range. These I can't go over 20 feet without the Sound becoming choppy. It only connects to one Bluetooth device .
customer_reviews.author: eve burr

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my 15yr old grandson
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grandson and he loves them. His friends all love them as well. He's had them for about 6 months now and uses them daily. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: sexy grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are great for the price. Pairs easily with my iPhone 11 and headphone controls track selection and volume well. Fits securely on the head and comfortable on the ears. I would recommend these for sure if anyone on a budget looking for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.  Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the JVCs prior to purchasing these and wish I had found these first. A real value for the price. Controls are extremely easy even with gloves. They are made to last and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Geist

customer_reviews.title: Cute, durable and have great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Holds a charge well, lasts all day. Good sound and these have lasted longer than the other models of Skullcandy headphones that I've owned previously. They are a good set of headphones for the price, no doubt!
customer_reviews.author: A. L.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones... but the ear coverings are falling off.
customer_reviews.text: Minimal usage in my studio (not shoved into any backpacks or traveled with), and the leather ear pad coverings are peeling up. Probably why they are now discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair from Sam's last year my husband like them but would not pair with the TV so we return them he regretted it so we bought this pair and a transmitter and he seems to love them
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feeling with these impressive headphones
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty, music sounds really good, price is amazing, great battery and really easy to connect. But, after about 2 hours of listening it really hurt my ears. It feels like they not pressing them hard but they actually does. Really need to pull them off to rest. Was quite annoying on my 9 hours flight due to that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Tal Gross

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, connect quick, lightweight. Have a noise canceling set but actually like the sound of these better. Bought a case that fits from Amazon as well.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: quality sound
customer_reviews.text: decent sound for the price, use on my bike, wouldn't run with these on, gets rid of ambient noise but can still hear whats going on around me.
customer_reviews.author: JEC

customer_reviews.title: GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few months now and I'm a big fan. Great for the price. Not overwhelmingly loud but I've learned to appreciate that. Nobody needs hearing damage. They hold a charge. Although they get a little uncomfortable over long periods of time, adjusting usually solves that. I sometimes fall asleep in them.
customer_reviews.author: Chantelle W

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy but can get painful after a long time i'd imagine like anything that goes on top of your ears. Bluetooth lasts a while, connection range is good
customer_reviews.author: zeinah

customer_reviews.title: Great product, wonderful stereo sound
customer_reviews.text: Great product, wonderful stereo sound, effortless and quick Blue tooth pairing. Fits like a dream, and I have a large head so they usually are too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Str8aero

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, sound great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter and ended up wishing I had bought a pair for myself as well. They are extremely comfortable and sound good.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Mr. Egg

customer_reviews.title: It was a great gift just last Christmas for a 14 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a great gift just last Christmas for a 14 year old and waited a while to post a review to see if he will still like it in the long run, durable, I and I guess I'll buy another one for the smaller guy.
customer_reviews.author: Armi

customer_reviews.title: Declining Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. He uses them everyday at work. Worked great for 10 months but now they crackle whenever he tries to use them. Going to have to look for a different brand that will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: C Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones. They work really well and they are easy to sync. They are comfortable on my ears.
customer_reviews.author: M. Link

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice headphones for the price. The sound quality is great, the setup is easy and they can be used both wired and wireless. The leather on the top look actually much nicer in reality than in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Holroyd

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Had same brand before but this one sits a bit tight on my head. I wish it had better adjustment capability.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I like them. NOT crusher status though.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not giving 5 stars t this item just because of the poor standby time, overall th sound has been great with awesome bass, clear vocals clear enough for ASMR content. I'm saving up for the Crushers. Also, I deducted one star because of the fit is a bit tight on my head, so it causes pain after a 1hrs or so of wearing nice range though. definitely, recommend these ones if you don't actually have the budget for the crushers or just want something for casual listening and be prepared to charge them several times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Good vibrations
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new wireless headset and it was a nice replacement. No booming sound but inexpensive and allows the commute to be bearable.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin P. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Solid 4 stars. I’ve had them for a year and half and they work like new. For this price point, I think they’re great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros Light weight Comfortable Good all around sound low to high Bargain priced Not hot (on the ear headphones) Durable if you don't try to thrash them Stylish Cons Not really I can think of. I'm not too much of a tech snob
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear and walk with, they broke in 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: They are very light. Easy to wear and walk with. Max wear time is 1 hours then ears hurt. They junk. Sound quality is bad, build quality is trash. Broke after 6 months! Do not buy. Worth about $20
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Pairs bluetooth perfectly at 29 feet away with new LG SK9000PUA television.
customer_reviews.author: Meister

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: i just received them yesterday. Easy to setup and use, they look great and are so comfortable on my ears. I cannot use the earbuds my ear canals are so small. The Skullcandy grind wireless are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Good quality headphones not cheap material
customer_reviews.text: This is the best headphones iv purchased. I recieved them January 25 2017. The music sound and quality is great. There great for talking in noisy places. iv had them almost two years now they want hold a charge, but still in good shape. I will purchase another...
customer_reviews.author: Daisy&Vance

customer_reviews.title: Good quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: Good quality headphones for the price. Might not be for the audiophile, but good highs, lows and midrange. A great QPR in the wireless headphone space!
customer_reviews.author: J. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Best blue tooth headsets that I've ever purchased before. Great sound, excellent battery life and really really comfortable. Got here in great condition looking forward to doing business with these guys again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Gray

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Links to bluetooth easily and quickly. Insulates from surroundings reasonably well -- I like to hear if there are any major outside problems. Sound is excellent. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DVD Viewer

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound and Build Quality, But Hurts the Ears
customer_reviews.text: Build is sturdy, materials look durable, stitching is well done. The sound is balanced, and it handles bass very well. It doesn't fold, so you might need a case. Major downside is that it hurts the ears after about 10-15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Poor comfort, great music sessions
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap and provide very good sound, i bring these everyday with me to school and they work perfectly. Unfortunately, they end up hurting my ears after long hours of using them
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Leroy

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth mode breaks the sound quality big time
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product doesn't work for me. Here is a list of problems I experienced: 1. Sound quality is terrible in Bluetooth mode. There is a lot statics when the unit is fully charged, very close to the source. And I tried with different sources (Macbook Pro and iPhone) too. None worked. Once I plugged in the audio cable, the sound quality bounced right up 2. It was too tight for my head - I don't have a big head at all. Yet after two days, I still have to take it off after 30min or so.
customer_reviews.author: Yibing Wu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These wireless headphones are great. I really like the sound. What I don't like is the lack of range.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable. They charge lasts a long time. The sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Denice A.

customer_reviews.title: Not for the gym
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not tight enough to wear in the gym. They just bounce off because the metal doesn't hold them onto your head like a cheaper molded plastic set.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: The sound and the build quality are very good. You can also answer calls and the people ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones for the price exceeded my expectations. The sound and the build quality are very good. You can also answer calls and the people on the other end did not realize I was using a pair of headphones. I highly recommend if you're looking for a budget-friendly headphones. The only negative for me if you're using for a long period of time they do hurt your ears because they sit right on them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Tough, good value
customer_reviews.text: Not particularly loud; don't sound awesome; but they're sturdy. Good gym headphones, if you don't bounce too much--cleans'll take'em right offaya.
customer_reviews.author: Sang Fezi

customer_reviews.title: Static noise in Bluetooth mode
customer_reviews.text: . Headphones look nice but not very comfortable, also Static noice in Bluetooth mode, you can also hear all the ambient noise around you
customer_reviews.author: vfeagle

customer_reviews.title: It's beautiful, sounds great, great quality and for a good price article, love it.
customer_reviews.text: It's beautiful, sounds great, great quality and for a good price article, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastián Zahn

customer_reviews.title: not for bass heads
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Solid construction, comfortable for long periods, long battery live, excellent connectivity and range Cons: No low end bass, moving the 60Hz slider virtually has no effect, no carrying case If you like a flat response and can live without low end these are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Erhan Hosca

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphone
customer_reviews.text: My brother is a destroyer but it doesnt break yet LOL
customer_reviews.author: Geric S. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent prodcut
customer_reviews.text: Great price, work great. Would be 5 stars but make my ears sore after awhile. That's prolly me but ... still 4 stars. Connect easily every time. Good call sound.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Baird

customer_reviews.title: No bass.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an okay model. But it doesn’t carry a lot of bass. Gets very distorted. What can you expect for $50.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Ward

product_meta.title: Skullcandy Grind Bluetooth Wireless On-Ear Headphones with Built-In Mic and Remote, 12-Hour Rechargeable Battery, Supreme Sound Audio, Plush Ear Pillows for Comfort, Black/Tan
product_meta.description: Color:BlackGrind Wireless delivers premium build and sound quality just like the wired version that inspired it. And like the original, it does it all without the premium price while also adding Bluetooth wireless listening and 12 long hours of battery life. For conveniently keeping you in control, it also has a built-in microphone and track, call, and volume controls built right into the ear cup.
feature_bullets: ALL-DAY FREEDOM: Grind Wireless lets you take more phone calls and rock late into the night with 12 hours of battery life and the wire-free wonderfulness of Bluetooth wireless streaming.
ALL-DAY COMFORT: Premium materials like the solid metal headband, plush on-ear pillows and Supreme Sound audio make slipping into Grind Wireless a stupefyingly comfortable experience.

ALL-DAY CONVENIENCE: Life should be easy, so the built-in controls on Grind Wireless are dead simple. Play and pause music, answer and end calls, skip tracks and adjust volume with just three buttons.
SUPREME SOUND: 40mm audio drivers tuned with Skullcandy's Supreme Sound make all types of music sound equally impressive.

BACK-UP AUX CABLE: If you've transcended the need to sleep and your 12-hour battery needs charging, just plug in the included AUX cord with microphone and remote and never miss a beat. Battery fully recharges in just 2.5 hours.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars802 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
